cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: squid:4 security update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: squid:4-8040020210420090912.522a0ee4 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)

notes.note: squid: improper input validation may allow a trusted client to perform HTTP request smuggling

reference.description: bz#1939925: CVE-2020-25097 squid: improper input validation may allow a trusted client to perform HTTP request smuggling

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
After installing this update, the squid service will be restarted automatically.

note:
An update for the squid:4 module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

Squid is a high-performance proxy caching server for web clients, supporting FTP, Gopher, and HTTP data objects.
Security Fix(es):
* squid: improper input validation may allow a trusted client to perform HTTP request smuggling (CVE-2020-25097)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
